result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario Rudy Martinez-Perea

records.addlTxt:
10:55 AM Fred Svensson Interpreter appears. 
Defendant Mario Rudy Martinez-Perea in court.  Attorney Roberto R Ledesma in court for Mario Rudy Martinez-Perea.  Attorney Corinne Frutiger appears special today for Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Victim compliance is complete.
Attorney Ledesma informs the court his client wishes to waive his right to preliminary hearing.
Court informs the defendant of his right to preliminary hearing and purpose of said hearing.
Court questions defendant re: his right to preliminary hearing.
Parties stipulate to a factual basis.
Court questions counsel re: his clients waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court finds waiver of preliminary is made freely, knowingly & voluntarily.
Court accepts waiver and orders bind over. 

Information was filed and formal reading waived.

Defendant enters plea of "NOT GUILTY".
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on December 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:20 AM Fred Svensson Interpreter appears. 
Defendant Mario Rudy Martinez-Perea in court.  Attorney Roberto R Ledesma in court for Mario Rudy Martinez-Perea.  Attorney Corinne Frutiger appears special today for Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant acknowledges criminal complaint.
Court verbally reviews charges/penalties for the record.
Court finds probable cause for filing.

Time limits waived for preliminary hearing

Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 4, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Initial appearance on September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
